examples: The end-of-year accounts show a loss.
Their bank account was in the red again.
John's bank account is in credit by $500.
Then the punishment of individuals invariably took account of the harm or damage done to the victim.
He gave a good account of himself in matches against Crewe and Chesterfield.
words.defineEn: to be considered or regarded in a particular way
words.defineVi: được xem xét hoặc xem xét trong một cách cụ thể

words.defineEn: a major or complete change in attitude, opinion, or behavior
words.defineVi: một sự thay đổi lớn hoặc hoàn toàn trong thái độ, ý kiến, hoặc hành vi

examples: Health services are lining the drug companies’ pockets, according to the report.
Everything's running according to plan.
According to recent polls, the finger of blame is pointing squarely at the president for the recent economic downturn.
according to 2001 Census Report, in a population of 365 million is like drop in the bucket and in numerical terms it is a total failure.
According to my brother Paul, this Lonnie Norton was asking a lot of questions and stirring up a hornet's nest around town.
words.defineEn: based on what someone has said or written
words.defineVi: dựa trên những gì ai đó đã nói hoặc viết

examples: Her advice fell on deaf ears.
His advice wasn't very helpful.
After all that struggle, their constructive advice fell on stony ground.
I should give you advice as a man to man.
She received false advice that led to negative consequences.
words.defineEn: a suggestion or an opinion that is given with regard to making the best decision in a specific situation
words.defineVi: một gợi ý hoặc một ý kiến được đưa ra liên quan đến việc đưa ra quyết định tốt nhất trong một tình huống cụ thể

examples: Dietary experts can advise on the ins and outs of dieting.
My doctor advised me to drink pasteurized milk during my pregnancy for the safety of my baby.
An old hand advised me that the fireman approach would suit my scrawny physique.
The doctor advised wearing protective clothing to minimize exposure to harmful radiation during the X-ray procedure.
They advised them to invest in better security measures.
words.defineEn: to provide someone with a suggestion regarding a specific situation
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó một gợi ý liên quan đến một tình huống cụ thể

words.defineEn: used to add a statement that contradicts what one has just said
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thêm một tuyên bố mâu thuẫn với những gì một người vừa nói

examples: The boss sure aired his lungs when we lost another customer!
The whole future of the project is still up in the air.
The scent of wild cherry blossoms filled the air, signaling the arrival of spring.
As I peel the Jaffa orange, its fragrant zest fills the air.
The scent of bergamot orange fills the air as I zest it over my freshly baked lemon bars.
words.defineEn: to let one's opinions or complains be known
words.defineVi: để cho ý kiến hoặc khiếu nại của một người được biết đến

examples: In their airing of grievances the people included demands to fix France’s system of weights and measures.
words.defineEn: a public expression or discussion of opinions
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện công khai hoặc thảo luận về ý kiến

examples: Just answering for yourself personally as opposed to the nation of deaf people.
Nothing was really being answered for hours at a time.
Each murder has to be answered for with another murder until we are out of people who can die.
But, crucially, the company needs to answer for what happened here.
Or is there anything I can answer for you?
words.defineEn: (usually negative) to state that someone else will have a particular opinion or will do something
words.defineVi: (thường là phủ định) để nói rằng người khác sẽ có ý kiến cụ thể hoặc sẽ làm điều gì đó

examples: Supporters of globalization assert that it is a win-win proposition for the rich and the poor.
She speaks softly and carries a big stick to assert her authority when necessary.

He had a bad experience with a difficult boss at his previous job, and now he's afraid to speak up or assert himself at work - illustrating how the man who has once been bitten by a snake fears every piece of rope.
Buda werehyena lore asserts that this blood was used for rituals, medicine, and nutrition.
Attorney General Barr asserted last month that the FBI had spied on the campaign.
words.defineEn: to behave confidently in a way that demands recognition of one's opinions
words.defineVi: cư xử tự tin theo cách đòi hỏi sự công nhận ý kiến của một người

examples: But Darvill rejects that assertion.
But Darvill rejects that assertion.
I just made a series of assertions.
The content of your assertion is your proposition.
That assertion has a truth value, but it’s indeterminate, because the show’s not over yet.
words.defineEn: a statement representing a fact or what you strongly believe in
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố đại diện cho một thực tế hoặc những gì bạn tin tưởng mạnh mẽ vào

words.defineEn: in an authoritative way that highlights one's beliefs clearly so that people take notice
words.defineVi: theo cách có thẩm quyền làm nổi bật niềm tin của một người một cách rõ ràng để mọi người chú ý

words.phonetic: æz fɑːɹ æz ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ ɪz kənsɜːnd
words.defineEn: used when someone gives their personal opinion, especially if it is in contrast with someone else's opinion
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi ai đó đưa ra ý kiến cá nhân của họ, đặc biệt nếu nó trái ngược với ý kiến của người khác

words.phonetic: æz fɑːɹ æz ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ ɪz kənsɜːnd
words.defineEn: used to talk or give an opinion about a specific thing or person
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói chuyện hoặc đưa ra ý kiến về một điều cụ thể hoặc người

words.defineEn: ‌used when you take the most optimistic view, especially in a bad situation
words.defineVi: ‌được sử dụng khi bạn có cái nhìn lạc quan nhất, đặc biệt là trong một tình huống xấu

examples: If it were mine, I would avow it.
words.defineEn: to publicly state that something is the case
words.defineVi: để tuyên bố công khai rằng một cái gì đó là trường hợp

words.defineEn: an open declaration or affirmation of one’s opinions
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố cởi mở hoặc khẳng định ý kiến của một người

examples: But after intense pressure from advocates and progressive Democrats, Biden backpedaled.
Charney later backpedaled, saying that Cieply had enormous credibility.
Various prominent artists like Kendrick Lamar came to the defense of the accused, and Spotify quickly backpedaled.
words.defineEn: to completely change one’s position on or opinion about something to not do what one has promised
words.defineVi: để thay đổi hoàn toàn vị trí của một người hoặc quan điểm về một cái gì đó để không làm những gì một người đã hứa

examples: I’m backtracking.
- I'm backtracking at this point.
So we'll backtrack a little bit.
If someone encounters a dead end, they should backtrack to the last intersection.
By the end of July 2020, President Trump had backtracked slightly on his hard stance that every school must reopen regardless of the community's transmission rates.
words.defineEn: to change one's opinion, or retract one's statement due to being under pressure
words.defineVi: để thay đổi ý kiến của một người, hoặc rút lại tuyên bố của một người do bị áp lực

examples: They both pay their employees badly.
This company badly needs to bring in some new blood.
The evening started badly when the speaker failed to turn up.
We've done very badly as far as planning is concerned.
Jack vented his spleen at his wife whenever things went badly at work.
words.defineEn: in an unfavorable or disapproving manner
words.defineVi: theo cách không thuận lợi hoặc không tán thành

examples: Basically, he was a bully, and like most bullies, he could dish it out, but couldn't take it.
The company wants to hire her at any cost, so she can basically take her pick of perks during the negotiation process.
Your grandmother will be there, and she is basically Mrs. Grundy!
The cast of 'Spring Awakening' was there, basically.
Drones date back much longer to early flight but like the modern drones basically trace their origin to the 80s.
words.defineEn: used to state one’s opinion while emphasizing or summarizing its most important aspects
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nêu ý kiến của một người trong khi nhấn mạnh hoặc tóm tắt các khía cạnh quan trọng nhất của nó

examples: As a journalist, I believe that fair play is a jewel, and it's important to report the truth without bias or prejudice.
Discrimination and bias in hiring practices can result in an unlevel playing field for job applicants, as qualified candidates from marginalized groups may face barriers and unequal treatment.
Bias sucks.
First of all, people are biased.
Third, it exhibits bias.
words.defineEn: an unfair behavior that favors or discriminates against someone or something
words.defineVi: một hành vi không công bằng ủng hộ hoặc phân biệt đối xử với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: As a journalist, I believe that fair play is a jewel, and it's important to report the truth without bias or prejudice.
Discrimination and bias in hiring practices can result in an unlevel playing field for job applicants, as qualified candidates from marginalized groups may face barriers and unequal treatment.
Bias sucks.
First of all, people are biased.
Third, it exhibits bias.
words.defineEn: to unfairly influence or manipulate something or someone in favor of one particular opinion or point of view, often to the detriment of others
words.defineVi: gây ảnh hưởng hoặc thao túng một cách không công bằng một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó để ủng hộ một ý kiến hoặc quan điểm cụ thể, thường gây bất lợi cho người khác

examples: She stepped on the gas but the car didn't budge.

But Mexico doesn’t budge.
- And even though America's debt has been growing steadily for decades, confidence in these bonds, hasn't budged.
You can feel resistance even if the book doesn't budge.
words.defineEn: to come to an agreement or make someone change their mind
words.defineVi: đi đến một thỏa thuận hoặc làm cho ai đó thay đổi suy nghĩ của họ

words.defineEn: to keep changing one’s attitude toward someone or something
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục thay đổi thái độ của một người đối với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to talk about something in a completely open and direct way

words.defineVi: để thay đổi ý kiến hoặc hành vi của một người đối với một cái gì đó

Arbery comes around the front of the truck.

words.defineEn: to completely change one's decision or opinion
words.defineVi: để thay đổi hoàn toàn quyết định hoặc ý kiến của một người

examples: Your painting has come out really well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
The other team came out and dominated our players like nobody's business.
The clouds broke and the sun came out.
He got a cut, and red blood came out.
words.defineEn: to express if one is for or against an idea or arguement
words.defineVi: để bày tỏ nếu một người là cho hoặc chống lại một ý tưởng hoặc lập luận

examples: When Mike comes over for dinner, he will make himself at home by offering to help in the kitchen and finding a cozy spot to relax.
So the doctor comes over.
Come over.
And this older guy comes over.
A hush comes over the anxious slaves.
words.defineEn: to completely change one’s point of view or side
words.defineVi: để thay đổi hoàn toàn quan điểm của một người hoặc bên

examples: Lots of people had left comments under the post.
Her comment about my work piqued my anger.
Bob's comment must have been close to home.
The Youtube comment sowed a seed of anger and untold frustrations which brought some questions to the forefront of her mind.
No one at the company could be reached for comment.
words.defineEn: a spoken or written remark that expresses an opinion or reaction
words.defineVi: một nhận xét nói hoặc viết thể hiện một ý kiến hoặc phản ứng

examples: Lots of people had left comments under the post.
Her comment about my work piqued my anger.
Bob's comment must have been close to home.
The Youtube comment sowed a seed of anger and untold frustrations which brought some questions to the forefront of her mind.
No one at the company could be reached for comment.

words.defineVi: để bày tỏ ý kiến của một người hoặc đưa ra lời giải thích về một cái gì đó

examples: And then we can confer on this.
You conferred with the president and you told him this?
But this case does suggest a first infection can confer some level of protection against later ones.
The write up of this case still needs to undergo peer review, but if the findings hold up against scrutiny, they’d suggest that prior infections don’t always confer protection.

words.defineEn: to exchange opinions and have discussions with others, often to come to an agreement or decision
words.defineVi: trao đổi ý kiến và thảo luận với người khác, thường là để đi đến một thỏa thuận hoặc quyết định

examples: Others converted in name only, out of fear, while others stuck to their faith.
Worms convert organic waste and other compostable products into natural fertilizers.
The information is converted into a jumble of nonsense.
This converts chemical energy into kinetic energy.
That molecule subsequently is converted into a sugar.
words.defineEn: to adopt a new set of principles, ideas, or methods
words.defineVi: để áp dụng một bộ nguyên tắc, ý tưởng hoặc phương pháp mới

words.defineEn: a strong statement or a piece of writing that expresses certain feelings and opinions
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố mạnh mẽ hoặc một đoạn viết thể hiện cảm xúc và ý kiến nhất định

words.defineVi: thể hiện cảm xúc của một người một cách ấn tượng và mạnh mẽ

examples: A person's character can often be deduced from their actions.

And then you're deducing other facts from those facts.
And so he accurately deduced that this would drive his numbers up with some segment of his base.
And so he accurately deduced that this would drive his numbers up with some segment of his base.
words.defineEn: to determine by a process of logical reasoning
words.defineVi: để xác định bởi một quá trình suy luận logic

examples: Now, the plants were deemed essential infrastructure and had to remain open.
And with a coin flip, half were randomly deemed prisoners and the other half guards.
The announcement of the state of the vote by the president of the Senate shall be deemed a sufficient declaration of the persons elected president and vice president of the United States.
When Jan van Eyck completed it in Ghent in 1432, it was immediately deemed the best painting in Europe.
But an important distinction is, none of the NIL legislation deems these student athletes as employees or workers.
words.defineEn: to consider in a particular manner
words.defineVi: để xem xét một cách cụ thể

examples: You delude yourself into thinking you can sing.
It turns out, people are remarkably good at deluding themselves.
And a lot of people, whatever, our waitress must have thought, well, they're deluded and insane.

Alongside these protesters another contender for influence arose a new Catholic movement Jansenism, called for a complete purging of the self and a fervent spirituality to replace the insufficient and even deluded practices of the church.
words.defineEn: to mislead someone or to make them believe something that is not true
words.defineVi: đánh lừa ai đó hoặc khiến họ tin vào điều gì đó không đúng sự thật

examples: The harsh criticism tore him out of his delusions of grandeur.
You have delusions.
Fregoli delusion has the opposite problem.
The delusions can take on a persecutory or nihilistic tone.
Delusions can be a part of other psychotic experiences like mania, depression, and substance intoxication or withdrawal.
words.defineEn: a reinforced false belief or opinion that someone has
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc ý kiến sai lầm được củng cố mà ai đó có

examples: We discuss current scientific advancements and discoveries in science class.

The parents attended the school meeting to discuss their child's progress.
words.defineEn: to talk or write about a subject in detail in while taking different perspectives and issues into consideration
words.defineVi: nói hoặc viết chi tiết về một chủ đề trong khi xem xét các quan điểm và vấn đề khác nhau

examples: These discussions held little interest for Lucy.

words.defineEn: an act or process of talking and sharing ideas in order to reach a decision or conclusion

words.defineEn: in a critical and arrogant manner therefore refusing to consider other's opinions
words.defineVi: theo cách chỉ trích và kiêu ngạo do đó từ chối xem xét ý kiến của người khác
